abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, with a highly likely sustainability and high
            institutional development impacts, achieved through highly
            satisfactory performances by the Bank and Borrower. Lessons
            reinforce that strong political will is necessary to
            accomplish the degree of reform and improved efficiency
            brought about in this project. Progress in projects with
            major reform agendas can be expected to encounter
            roadblocks, which require continuous follow-up and support
            from donors and the government agencies involved. The
            project had the full support of the Government at the
            highest levels, and, managers were also strongly committed
            to the project objective. On the Government side, support
            for railway reform remained a priority, although it took
            more time to carry out reforms that required Government
            decisions. Moreover, a strong business base and demand for
            services is important: road transport was not competitive in
            the transport of phosphate between the mines and the ports,
            (phosphate traffic accounts for 50 percent of the total
            revenues), thus, the adjustment of phosphate tariffs,
            including an escalation clause, which had been a condition
            of the Bank's loan, eased the railway's financial
            situation in the early project stages, and enabled
            management to focus on restructuring. Yet, it is also
            reiterated that for this type of project, major information
            technology (IT) spending should be postponed until after
            much of the restructuring and reform has been achieved,
            particularly for large management information and control
            systems, in order to ensure that it is appropriate for the
            new management setting, and that the equipment will be
            properly utilized.
